Reviews.Title: “A Great Little Place”
Reviews.Author: Hamadi1958
Reviews.Content: A found the Sur Hotel on the web. This is a well priced small hotel with an excellent staff. "Oscar" an Istanbul native and the main fellow at the front desk during the day is both well informed and very friendly. He speaks english very well. In the evening, Atilla was also very helpful. My ensuite room was simple and wholly comfortable and just steps away from the Blue Mosque. The Sur has an authentic feel about it. The included breakfast is very nice with an outstanding view of the Marmara. I've traveled many places in Europe and Asia and the Sur ranks very highly.

Reviews.Title: “very good experience”
Reviews.Author: klotoida
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sur hotel for 10 days, and it was very good. The hotel price was ok, and everything we asked for, they provided. We also got a free ride from and to the airport which was great, and they didn't mind that our flight to Istanbul was almost 2 hours late. The rooms are small, but that was expected and we didn't mind that at all.

Reviews.Title: “An unexpected find”
Reviews.Author: Karl S
Reviews.Content: This was another one of those kinds of circumstances that make you believe that something like good luck really exists in your life. Coming back from Urfa, I again found the town to be packed, but I managed to find this one single room at the Sur Hotel. I loved it and moreover loved the staff here. An outstanding bunch of people who bend over backwards to help any way they can. I almost hated having to leave there. I had a wonderful room that lacked nothing, still, they wanted to move me to a better room, but I declined. I liked it where I was. The breakfast room, as you can see, is lovely with view of the Bosporus, and the breakfast leaves little to be desired. All in all, a great place to spend your Istanbul visit in. I like to walk, and to me the location was excellent. Within five minutes I was at the bazaar next to the Blue Mosque. All else is right there, too. The top picture that I took from the breakfast room one afternoon shows you how close you are. For my next trip there, this is where I expect to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't look any further”
Reviews.Author: Omernkerim
Reviews.Content: I must admit after we booked our flights I was worried about finding a decent hotel to stay in.I searched on the net and then decided to check out the ones I found using tripadvisor. After reading the horror stories about some of the hotels people had stayed at I found this one and instantly knew this was the one. When reviews mention the owners name and how good he was you know that this is a good place. Booking was effortless via email and we paid at the end not the beginning like some of the hotels. Shaban arranged our transfers as well and everything went smoothly. We will definitely book again with them.

Reviews.Title: “Sur Hotel Marathon Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Terry K
Reviews.Content: A great weekend in Istanbul, we contacted Sur Hotel to look after 17 of us coming over for the Marathon weekend. The staff went out of their way to offer advice and help. The rooms were basic but clean. Location was perfect for us, The daily breakfast was very good, the staff even arranged an early 06.30 breakfast on Marathon day. Thanks for a great weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Trains run through your bedroom”
Reviews.Author: onemoresmith
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in Ekhim apartments and three nights in the Sur hotel, both are owned by the same group. Saban and his team are fantastic people - really nice, accommodating and you feel like you are getting genuinely good advice. We were moved from the apartment after two nights to the Sur hotel - they were apologetic about moving us and gave us the choice of another apartment or the hotel. The hotel room was a single family room, had a view and included breakfast so we took that. Mistake. We didn't notice the train tracks and the commuter trains that run by your room every 15 minutes pretty much all through the night. We could hardly sleep it was so ridiculously loud (we even posted a YouTube clip of it). So don't get a room on the water side. The street side might be better. Beds and pillows were average and e bathroom smelled over time (recurring theme in turkey) but there was hot water and everything worked. Availability was low across istanbul but we found ourselves wondering if there was better value elsewhere for 80 eur/night. We stayed because the people were nice and it was rainy - a pain to move anywhere else but it would be worth looking around.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, clean, ideal location, nice food, fantastic help from staff”
Reviews.Author: charlton97
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Sur in May 2011 for the Gran Prix, we stayed 5 nights and thought the hotel was fantastic value for money. The rooms are clean and quite spacious, the views from the breakfast terrace are stunning and the breakfast is always fresh and very nice. The staff are brilliant and very helpful. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location is near turism area but also in the not so nice area of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: dan1958
Reviews.Content: The place was well kept. The room was OK. It was clean. Beyond the commodities, what we also had was an amazing quality of service from the owner and his family. He went out of his way to help us and make our stay as best as possible.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, people and place”
Reviews.Author: fanisp
Reviews.Content: all nice in the hotel the location is very good and very quite to have nice sleep, very good view in the breakfast balkony. easy to find the hotel in the city. people there are can help you for anything you want. warning the dog in the door (when you arrive), it is so big like a bear!!! and so nice!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, friendly, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: LindsayP020
Reviews.Content: Sur Hotel is a small hotel with very friendly staff, great location. The rooms are either quite large or medium-sized but are fine for a city hotel. Nice to have a little fridge in the room. The breakfast was served on the top floor with great view of the Sea of Marmara by lovely ladies who made sure that the buffet was constantly filled with fresh fruits etc. Staff was helpful and attentive, also nice people to have a chat with to get to know the culture. Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “SImply great”
Reviews.Author: Gregg161
Reviews.Content: I just came back from Istanbul, where I stayed at an apartment building connected to the Sur Hotel. I've chosen that one because of good experience of my last stay in Istanbul which I had in a building of the same manager (Saban). Also this time I got a great stay in the other building. It was really comfortable and made one feel like being at home. The apartment had everything you can need: a kitchen, a seperated bedroom, television, dvd-player and free wifi. i'll definitely try to stay there again when I come to Istanbul again, what's hopefully going to be soon.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Profi75
Reviews.Content: It started badly because I couldn't get any response by e-mail but once eventually I got an e-mail from them, I had only positive relationships with them. The hotel itself is nicely located, just 5 minute-walk from the Blue Mosque and 10 minutes from the tram stop of Sultanahmet. It's small with a few rooms. Me and my fiancee occupied the top room no.8 just next to the kitchen and the dining room which has a fabulous view at the Marmara Sea. The room is quite small but cosy. It has a large double bed, very comfortable and a tiny bathroom. It makes a bit of a problem as there is no a shower cabin and you need to shower on the floor. Anyway, it didn't bother us too much. The hotel is very clean, the food is quite good, always fresh products and the staff, well, the staff is just as it should be. They are more than polite and helpful. It doesn't matter if you meet them in the early morning or in the middle of the night 9as it happened to us because we were leaving for the airport at 3 am), they are as helpful as they normally are. Excellent people. The price per room, per night was â‚¬45 including breakfast. Transport from the airport â‚¬20. Wi-Fi worked OK. Strongly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “It was nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chris_Finland
Reviews.Content: When I visit the istanbul absolutly I stay in Sur Hotel.Great location,close the all historical places,restaurants.Staff is friendly,they answers all questions with smiley face. Breakfast is nice at the terrace with wonderfull view.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful and pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: kathwaddy
Reviews.Content: All staff happy to answer any questions and assist in sightseeing directions .Lovely to have clean towels everyday that was a luxury.Great view from breakfast terrace

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience - great location, helpful staff, good rooms”
Reviews.Author: Susanrr2
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay at Sur Hotel for a total of 7 days at the beginning and end of our 10 day trip to Istanbul. It is in the Old City, very convenient to sites and transportaion and on a quiet street. Our rooms in the main building were fine, the roof terrace has great views of the sea and the staff is very helpful. Regarding the previous review, we were shown a room in the annex and chose not to stay there. However, we highly recommend the main building.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but way below expectations”
Reviews.Author: Marius_Apostu
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my wife, for 8 nights, starting on September 3. We arrived at the hotel around 11 am, Reception told us that they did not clean the room yet, so we had to wait. We were led on the terrace where breakfast is served, where we were each served with a coffee and asked to wait until the room was ready. After about 45 minutes, the maid came to lead us into the room, at which appeared a very unpleasant surprise. Although I have made the booking made four months before, I was led into an annex of the hotel, in a room full of mold because of water that drained from the bath, with walls so badly cracked that I prayed the ceilling won't collapse on us, and windows that were not closing. We immediately locked the room and went to reception to ask for the hotel room we payed for, but the guy from Reception told us that by Tuesday there is no room available and he cannot help us change it. We were practically forced to 3 nights sleeping in the room that was not worthy even for a 1 star hotel. Eventually, after much insistence, Tuesday After breakfast, we were moved to the main hotel building, in a clean room, just like the one on the hotel website. From here was much more our stay became much more pleasant. The major problem is the hotel that sits right next to the railroad and the noise from the passing trains is quite hard to ignore. The good thing is that the trains do not run after 23 pm. Breakfast is very basic ....... cheese, a sausage that looks awful, yogurt, olives, tomatoes, cucumbers, fruits,Coffee / tea ...... We were also very shocked to see that they were also serving frech fries at breakfast ....... Never seen that before ...... EVER !! The good part is that the hotel is very close to tourist attractions in Sultanahmet. Unfortunately due to the bad experiences, i cannot recommend this hotel to those wishing to visit Istanbul, although is "TOP VALUE" here on Tripadvisor. There are many hotels in Sultanahmet and certainly you can find something better in the same price category.

Reviews.Title: “Good service in a low cost hotel”
Reviews.Author: hunm
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights either side of a tour and had selected this hotel based on the cost 50euro per night and the location, aware that we would not be staying in 5 star luxury but hopeful of finding decent accommodation. Upon our early morning arrival we were pleasantly surprised we could check into our room and take a much overdue shower before heading out to see the city sights. The room was not in the main hotel building but just next door and unfortunately was a tired affair which didn't smell that fresh and fell short of expectations. There was however plenty of space and it was perfectly adequate for our needs that day. When we returned from our tour for a second night we were put in a room in the main hotel and this room met all expectations for cleanliness and comfort. The breakfast up on the roof was nice and plentiful, although the hovering staff made us feel a little uncomfortable. The service at reception was fantastic, they did all the could help us out when needed and the wee puppy, who came to work sometimes was so adorable we were smitten. There is a computer with free internet in reception and the hotel location is brilliant for accessing all the central city sights. Overall I would recommend this hotel as long as your expectations are realistic and you get a room in the man hotel.

Reviews.Title: “So-so hotel for the Grand Prix weekend”
Reviews.Author: Smilerneil
Reviews.Content: Booked the Sur Hotel based upon price, location and previous reviews. Having stayed in Istanbul previously, the price was good value and location is good being a stone's throw from the Blue Mosque in the old town. Breakfast are as good as reported elsewhere. What was dissapointing was being "bumped" for our first night having booked 6 months in advance splitting our group up and resutling in moving hotel twice. Also if you are a light sleeper avoid the hotel due to the train track next door. it's not a bad hotel, its not the best either, worth considering along with the 100's of others in Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Location, Trains, Mold”
Reviews.Author: daetime
Reviews.Content: For a last minute trip to Istanbul I sought advise on Tripadvisor as usual. Easter weekend was very busy with tourists but Sur Hotel had a room. The hotel location in the historic part of the city is great, walking distance to many historic sites and the tram, but our room was on the side of the hotel that is 40 feet from the railroad track and trains run every 10 minutes (but not between 12 midnight and 6 AM). We were hardly ever in our room, so much to see and do in Istanbul, but no one mentioned the trains! It was interesting to wake one morning to see a freight train of military tanks going by! The room also looks out on the water and that was beautiful. The room ceiling paint was peeling off and there was black mold on the bathroom ceiling. Yuck. The bathroom itself was about 4 1/2 feet by 6 feet (that includes hand held shower, toilet, sink) with a drain on the floor. That being said the staff was very nice and very helpful, giving directions, advice, recommending restaurants (Doy Doy is close, reasonable and good). The breakfast room is lovely looking out on the water and the food was delicious, fresh, plentiful. I suppose I would advise anyone looking into this hotel to ask which side of the hotel the room being considered is located. Also there are many other small, similar hotels in the area. I would recommend seeing the Blue Mosque but in addition see the uncrowded "New" Yeni Cami Mosque near the spice market. Don't miss the underground cistern, Hagia Sophia and the Topkapi Palace. There is a nice bazaar near the Blue Mosque and the Mosaic Museum. The weather in early April was warm and beautiful, the evenings were cool and nice. The Tulip Festival was in full bloom, music in the plazas. It is a fantastic city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fantastic staff, the breakfast terrace is stunning!”
Reviews.Author: Tankalou
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a weekâ€™s trip to Istanbul and we stayed at Sur hotel (thanks to Trip Advisor reviews â€“ they have never let me down!). All said about this lovely hotel is true â€“ it is small but has everything that you need and we were treated really well by staff at the hotel, they are lovely people, we canâ€™t thank them enough. The breakfast terrace has a stunning view of the Marmara Sea, we were at awe when we went up there for our first breakfast. It was open in the evenings too if you wanted to read a book and look at all the city and boat lights at night. We often go to Turkey on holidays and my husband is Turkish, and this time we both agreed that the hotel personnel was highly professional which makes a big difference to your holiday! It is a basic place, but well-kept and is located short walking distance from St. Sofia and the Blue Mosque as well as Topkapi Palace, so what else could one wish for if you are out and about all day sightseeing! We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel With Amazingly Mannered Staff”
Reviews.Author: hutchings2305
Reviews.Content: The only way i can describe the hotel is nothing but amazing. The staff were well mannered and pleasing to see. If you ever get a chance to stay at this beautiful hotel and be lucky enough to meet a great friendly person named Ozgar this will make your holiday complete

Reviews.Title: “HOME AWAY FROM HOME”
Reviews.Author: Ljacomelli
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel-Wonderful people who are very friendly and have a great sense of humour. Its very relaxed and intimate atmosphere. Ask for Ozgur and say Jack sent you.

Reviews.Title: “A friendly hotel with excellent location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: M4RCUS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sur Hotel for 6 days after walking in and being impressed with the friendliness of the reception staff and price for the excellent location right in the heart of old Istanbul. We tend to have to travel on a budget and we don't worry too much about having all the mod cons. Having said that, the Sur Hotel had all (and more) than we required. The room (with bathroom) was a nice size with a balcony on to the street side, internet and heating were included and the staff went out of their way to make sure we had everything we asked for. The breakfast (also included in the prize), was fresh and plentiful and my coffee cup was constantly filled as soon as i had finished my previous cup. I think the staff are what made the stay extra nice, from recommending places to go, giving tips about the local customs, lending us umbrellas, power cords, games, etc and even talking to taxi drivers to ensure we got back to the hotel for the correct prize and without fuss when needed. So thankyou to Ozgur and his great team - we'd certainly be happy to stay at the Sur Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, friendly people”
Reviews.Author: nkswami
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed for about 4 days at the Sur Hotel in Istanbul, and had a very pleasant stay. The location is fabulous and the hotel staff was extremely friendly. The rooms and bathrooms were clean and comfortable, with a nice breakfast on the terrace. Complete value for money. Highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: PamTunbridgeWells
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly recommend this hotel. The rooms are spotless, the staff couldn't be more helpful. A buffet breakfast isoffered on the terrace with wonderful views of the Sea of Marmara and had a very good choice of cheese, meat, fruit etc. We were fortunate to be allocated a room which also had a sea view. Internet access is available free of charge. All the major sites around Sultanahmet Square are within easy walking distance but the area around the hotel was quiet and peaceful.

Reviews.Title: “Charming B&B, good value for money!”
Reviews.Author: smileyfacegrace
Reviews.Content: This B&B was very clean and charming. It was located right in Sultanahmet, so only a 5-10 minute walk from the Blue Mosque. It's far enough away that you're away from the noise of the square and the top floor terrace has a great view of the sea. Our room faced the train tracks, but the noise didn't bother us. The receptionist was very nice and he even arranged for us to take a Turkish bath at a cheaper place, and arranged a taxi to take us there free of charge. Overall, I was very pleased with this B&B. The staff were very nice and helpful. However, I would note that it is difficult to find this hotel - you should call ahead of time and ask them to arrange an airport transfer. My friend and I were searching Sultanahmet for this place and would never have found it were it not for the locals helping us! Also, dragging a wheeled suitcase over the cobblestone streets proves to be difficult, so get the airport transfer to make your life easier. =)

Reviews.Title: “home away from home”
Reviews.Author: mrandmrshussain
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Istanbul and staying at Sur Hotel made it all the more better. Excellent service, room, staff, access to main tourist attractions and anything else you did or did not ask for! Wonderful...thinking of our next visit already!

Reviews.Title: “Great place friendly advice very good experience”
Reviews.Author: Faraway2009
Reviews.Content: This hotel was so good that we ended up staying twice in our turkey adventure. Ozgur the main man is friendly genuine and all round good bloke. You feel welcome from the moment you walk in. Rooms are clean and tidy, breakfast has variety. I totally recommend it !

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: meljhart
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for first time visitors to Istanbul - it is easily accesible from the airport (using the train and metro service), though it was very hard to find initially (we had to rely on locals to direct us). It is close to all the touristy areas in Sultanamhet, and equally accessible to Beyoglu (which is across the river from Sultanamhet but accessible via metro) which is where all the shopping and late nightlife is. Only two minor issues: the bathrooms are small - our one case in point was the size of a normal 'toilet only' room, however it had the loo, shower, sink, everything in it. This was fine for us as we are reasonably young and agile, however this may not suit for other travellers. And the breakfast was definitely not up to the standard of the rest of the places we had eaten at on our 2 week trip through Turkey. Good value for money and a great view out over the harbour from the breakfast room.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay.”
Reviews.Author: gdpapage
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel by accident. Friends we traveled with had booked in a nearby hotel that had no more rooms. The hotel experience was overall very positive. By not booking ahead of time we got a better rate (55 Euros per night). The street was very quiet and access to all sights was very easy either by walking or by tram. We chose a street-side room because the side with the spectacular view of the Bosphorus is next to the railroad tracks and with many trains going by it could have been uncomfortable although the windows seemed to be quite well insulated. The view of the Bosphorus from the rooftop where we ate breakfast was spectacular. Breakfast food was OK. The room itself was comfortable and clean and the bed not as hard as many European beds so we slept quite well. The staff (especially Yaseen) were great!! Polite and helpful and his English quite good. The AC and everything else worked fine and I would highly recommend the hotel for people with "reasonable" expectations. One weak point can be the lack of an elevator. We are in our late 50s but we had no problem with that. Others, however, could.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Caneguy26
Reviews.Content: Probably the worst hotel in Istanbul! Terrible location, bad service, overpriced for what you get, small rooms, no electricity/water at times. Do I need to go on? Yes, I can - the list is endless - WC not working, breakfast not tasty, hotel employees rude/ignorant, they enter into rooms without permisson trying to steal...

Reviews.Title: “MY HOME!!!”
Reviews.Author: redtower
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sur last June at the peak of tourist season. This is the most beautiful hotel I have ever stayed in. The views of Istanbul looking down the Bosphorus are incredible. The Sur is located at a bend of the Bosphorus giving you incredible views up and down the Bosphorus. The fresh seafood at the restaurants around the hotel was excellent. The ferry service provided by the hotel was kind of lacking but taking the public transportation from the city dock was no problem at all. The hotel staff was very courteous and helpful. I wouldnâ€™t hesitate to stay at the Sur Hotel again or to recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “''Sur Hotel'' WONDERFUL!!!”
Reviews.Author: brian00
Reviews.Content: I just got back from two weeks trip to Istanbul, the friendliest and most hospitable country I've ever visited. In Istanbul, I stayed at theSur Hotel, a small, charming boutique hotel in the historic. It is a walking distance to all the historic sites and attractions like Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, Museum of Islamic Arts, the Grand Bazaar, etc., tramway station and the ferry. Everyone from the General Manager to the housekeeping staff was helpful and friendly. They made us feel that their aim is to please and make our stay a positive and memorable experience. They are always cheerful, polite, helpful and professional in their jobs. We loved everythÄ°ng about this hotel. In all, it was a great stay and I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My home in Istanbul!!!”
Reviews.Author: pelagagge
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Sur hotel from June 30 to the 2 nd July after a two week cruise in the Greek Isles. From the moment you arrive, you are greeted by friendly receptionist and an abundance of smiles. Firstly, let it be said, that service, comfort and quality were all exceptional. I booked directly with the hotel's website since it had the best offer, better then all the other sites I know that offer hotels deals (expedia, tablet etc.) The location was perfect for us. Its on a quiet side street but not isolated from necessities. It is located in old Istanbul. We only used the taxi to/from the airport. The staff are very friendly and the whole hotel has a comfortable and relaxed feel. The breakfast room(terrace) is bright and the food was prepared to a high standard, again combined with a warm, friendly service. Despite being a little small, our room (No.8) was furnished very tastefully and with its views over the hotel's rear terrace, offered a quiet hideaway from the hustle and bustle of city life. I had told the hotel when booking that it was a birthday treat and on our arrival back that night we found a chilled bottle of champagne it the room with a personalised message. The hotel -like all of this area-is relatively new and was a great location for our short visit. The foyer is astonishing, the rooms are luxurious, the service outstanding and the food excellent. The food.... The staff..... The rooms... everything Magic!!! There was nothing wrong with this hotel, as soon as we got there we were treated like royalty. Did the hotel meet my expectations? Yes it did. What more can be said about this hotel. This is my new home in Istanbul and I am going to let all my traveling retired friends aware of the exceptional value.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and great location”
Reviews.Author: omansyahrul
Reviews.Content: Me and a close friend of mine stayed at Sur Hotel for seven nights from June 16. Sur Hotel was an excellent choice in the Sultanahmet (Old City) area of Istanbul.The Hotel is centrally located near to most of the Historical Places. The breakfast was great in their roof-top. The rooftop(breakfast room) offers panoramic views. It was most enjoyable place, which I hadnâ€™t met, with great views Sea of Marmara. Since we were there in the summer we had the space to ourselves much of the time. The breakfast was adequate with cheeses, meats, tomatoes, cucumbers, turkish meals, excellent bread and roles, and tea or coffee. The staff were extremely helpful, giving us advice on where to go, what to expect, how much to pay in the taxis... Not only is the service great, the location of this hotel is outstanding. And their driver is very nice. They picked up us from airport. If you book directly through the hotel and stay for three or more nights, this service is complimentary. My room had a sea view that was most enjoyable and worth the small additional charge. If you are looking to make all aspects of your trip perfect look no further. I don't like to repeat hotels, but I would consider to repeat Sur Hotel in my next trip to Istanbul... I wouldnâ€™t hesitate to stay at the Sur Hotel again or to recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: bestales
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Sur Hotel in March 2007. My wife and I spent five wonderful nights at this hotel and would highly recommend it to anyone traveling to Istanbul. We'd heard great reports about the Sur Hotel so we made reservation through internet. This a great hotel is in a great location. It is located on a street which is five minutes distances from Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and TopkapÄ± Palace. Very near the tram and the centre. It is close not only the historical places but also markets and restaurants. The whole hotel and terrace reflect its elegant and colourful style and it attends to every detail in person. Staying at Sur hotel makes you feel like as if you are staying with your friends in your home, they are very friendly and helpful. Service and the room quality was excellent. The rooms are still very relaxing and comfortable. Good breakfasts in terrace overlooking Marmara Sea. Very very good value for Money. From the moment we entered to the hotel and till to our departure this was a top notch experience. The Hotel is wonderful, the city is lovely, the people are friendly If you go to Istanbul, stay there - you won't regret it - I can't think of any adverse comments.
